ETYMOLOGY: From Latin ēlabī ('to slip away, glide away'), from ē- ('out') + lābī ('to slip, glide')

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: intransitive verb: a verb that does not take a direct object
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Of time) to pass or go by.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Many years have elapsed since we last met.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 自我们上次见面以来，许多年已经过去了。
